main event: A UFO observation report was filed on 21 August 1969 in Westland, Michigan, regarding an unidentified object possibly identified as Capella.
interesting points: The observation lasted from 10:05 to 12:30 AM on August 22, 1969, during which multiple officers reported seeing a brightly lit object in the sky., Officers noted changes in the object's intensity while it remained in a fixed position., A smaller tri-color object was also observed approaching and moving out of sight., The Chief of Police expressed a newfound openness to UFO sightings based on reports from military officers and his own department., There was confusion regarding a meteor report that did not explain the sightings.
witness description: officers from the Westland Police Department
